item.title: Question mark over Rohit’s place in side: Gambhir says decision to be made “after a look at pitch” - The Indian Express
item.description:
Questions Surround Rohit Sharma's Place in Indian Cricket Team Ahead of Final Test

Publication Date: Not mentioned
Source: Indian Express

Speculations surrounding the future of Indian captain Rohit Sharma have increased as the team prepares for the final Border-Gavaskar Trophy Test at Sydney. Coach Gautam Gambhir indicated that a decision on Rohit's inclusion will depend on the pitch conditions.

  • Rohit's current average in the series stands at 6.20.
  • Gambhir states that the decision will be made after assessing the pitch.
  • Concerns over Rohit's poor form and multiple dismissals have led to questions about his place in the team.
  • Rohit's scoring sequence since September has been less than impressive, with low scores in recent matches.
  • India has a chance to draw the series 2-2, making Rohit's form even more critical.
“We shall look at the pitch and take a call tomorrow.” - Gautam Gambhir

The situation presents a pivotal moment for Rohit Sharma, with the team's chances in the series resting on the decision of the management regarding his selection.

item.title: Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt, Raha Kapoor enjoy first sunset of 2025 with extended family in Thailand. See pic - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt, Raha Kapoor enjoy first sunset of 2025 with extended family in Thailand

Publication Date: Jan 02, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt, and their daughter Raha Kapoor are enjoying their New Year's celebration in Thailand with extended family. The gathering includes several notable family members, capturing memorable moments during their holiday.

  • Riddhima Kapoor shared a family portrait on Instagram, saying, “Memories made together last a lifetime.”
  • The family includes familiar faces like filmmaker Ayan Mukerji, Alia's sister Shaheen Bhatt, and mother Soni Razdan.
  • A touching video of Ranbir embracing Alia at midnight was shared by Neetu Kapoor on Instagram.
  • Ranbir and Alia will next be seen in the movie Love & War.
A touching video captured the moment Ranbir ran to embrace Alia as the clock struck midnight.

The Kapoor family's New Year celebration in Thailand highlights the joy of family gatherings and the warmth of shared experiences.

item.title: 'Always poses a challenge': Pat Cummins praises Jasprit Bumrah ahead of Sydney Test - The Times of India
item.description:
Pat Cummins Praises Jasprit Bumrah Ahead of Sydney Test

Date: January 3, 2023
Source: Times of India

Australia captain Pat Cummins has heaped praise on India’s pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah, acknowledging his exceptional form and consistent ability to trouble batters across all formats. Speaking ahead of the fifth and final Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy at the Sydney Cricket Ground, Cummins admitted that facing Bumrah is always a daunting task.

  1. Cummins praised Bumrah’s exceptional form and consistent ability to trouble batters.
  2. Cummins admitted that facing Bumrah is always a daunting task.
  3. Australia has the chance to secure the Border-Gavaskar Trophy and secure their place in the World Test Championship final with a win or draw in Sydney.
  4. Australia has confirmed changes in their lineup, with Mitch Marsh dropped and Beau Webster set to make his debut.
  5. Mitchell Starc has been retained despite carrying a rib niggle.
"Bumrah is bowling well at the moment. He is always tough. Hopefully, by the time I come in, late in the day, he has bowled quite a bit, which might make it a bit easier for me. But he is bowling well. I’ve faced him quite a bit across the world in different formats, and he always poses a challenge."

Cummins confirmed a few changes in Australia’s lineup, with all-rounder Mitch Marsh dropped following a string of underwhelming performances, and Beau Webster set to make his debut. Mitchell Starc has been retained despite carrying a rib niggle and will feature in the bowling attack alongside Cummins, Scott Boland, and Nathan Lyon.

item.title: New Orleans truck attack: Joe Biden says FBI found ISIS-inspired Shamsud-Din Jabbar posted videos hours before rampage - Hindustan Times
item.description:
ISIS-Inspired Attack in New Orleans: President Biden Condemns Rampage, FBI Investigates

Date & Source: January 1, 2025, Hindustan Times

Introduction: A truck attack in New Orleans on New Year's Eve left at least 15 people dead and dozens injured, with the FBI linking the suspect to ISIS-inspiration.

  1. US Army veteran Shamsud-Din Jabbar, inspired by ISIS, drove a pickup truck into a crowd on Bourbon Street.
  2. Jabbar posted videos hours before the attack, expressing his desire to kill.
  3. President Joe Biden condemned the attack, offered condolences, and assured the public that the FBI is investigating.
  4. The truck attack turned festive Bourbon Street into a macabre mayhem of maimed victims and fleeing pedestrians.
  5. The FBI believes Jabbar was not solely responsible and is investigating potential associates and explosives found at the scene.

“This is not just an act of terrorism. This is evil.” - New Orleans Police superintendent Anne Kirkpatrick

Conclusion: The FBI is actively investigating the New Orleans truck attack, treating it as an act of terrorism, with President Biden offering condolences to the victims and their families.

item.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade - Moneycontrol
item.description:
First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade

Date: January 02, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The GIFT Nifty indicates a negative start for the day, with oil steady and gold having a significant annual gain since 2010.

  • The Indian markets started the new year positively but are expected to open lower today.
  • Sensex ended January 1 up 368.40 points, while Nifty closed 98.10 points higher.
  • GIFT Nifty trading around 23,838 this morning.
“Hope you're all set for today's trade, we wish you a profitable day ahead.”

Expectations are mixed as traders assess future monetary policies and global market conditions.

item.title: Jennifer Garner’s family 'wants' her back with ex Ben Affleck especially after… - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Jennifer Garner's Family Hopes for Reunion with Ex-Husband Ben Affleck

Published on: Jan 02, 2025 06:57 AM IST

Jennifer Garner's family is rooting for a reunion between the actress and her ex-husband Ben Affleck, as the former couple has been spending quality time together with their children, including during holidays. While Garner maintains a relationship with her current beau, John Miller, her family believes there's still chemistry between her and Affleck.

Garner and Affleck, who share three children, have been spotted together recently, fueling speculation about a possible reconciliation. The 'Gone Girl' star is currently going through a high-profile divorce from Jennifer Lopez.

  1. Garner's family is hoping for a reunion.The former couple has been spending more time together.Affleck's friends and family are supportive of a reunion.Garner's current partner, John Miller, may feel like a 'third wheel.'
"Ben is laying it on thick, he’s giving Jen so much of himself and his attention and being so charming," a source told In Touch. "It’s very hard not to love him when he’s acting this way, and a lot of people are predicting that they could end up back together."

While there's no confirmation of a reunion, Garner's family and friends are optimistic about the possibility of the former couple getting back together.

item.title: Top Stock Picks For 2025: Axis Securities highlights 16 names with up to 40% upside - CNBCTV18
item.description:

Axis Securities has released its list of top stock picks for 2025, featuring 16 names with potential upsides ranging from 10% to 40%. The list includes a mix of largecap, midcap, and smallcap stocks.

  1. ICICI Bank: +17% (Buy, ₹1,500 price target)
  2. SBI: +31% (Buy, ₹1,040 price target)

item.title: Stock market today: Trade setup for Nifty 50 to global markets; 5 stocks to buy or sell on Thursday — 2 January 2025 | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Nifty 50 and Global Markets Outlook: 5 Stock Picks for Thursday, January 2, 2025

Date & Source: January 2, 2025, Live Mint

Introduction: The first trading day of 2025 ended positively with the Nifty 50 index gaining 0.41% and the S&P BSE Sensex up by 0.47%. Bank Nifty also saw gains of 0.39%.

  1. The Nifty 50 index rebounded to ₹23,742.90 levels with immediate resistance at 23,870 and support at 23,537.
  2. Bank Nifty is expected to trade within the 50,500–52,000 range, with a breakout in either direction determining its future direction.
  3. The market started positively on the first day of 2025, with broad-based recovery aided by positive earnings growth expectations and an uptick in core sector data.
  4. Five stocks have been recommended for buying or selling by experts.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

"The market started positively on the first day of 2025... An uptick in core sector data and the prospect of a ramp-up in capex spending by the government in the remaining part of the fiscal aided sectors like capital goods, industrials, auto, and power." - Vinod Nair, Head of Research, Geojit Financial Services

Conclusion: The article provides an overview of the first trading day of 2025, the outlook for global markets, and expert recommendations for five stocks based on technical analysis.

item.title: Pushpa 2 box office collection Day 28: Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna starrer shatters records; earns o - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Pushpa 2: The Rule Collector's Day 28 Box Office Success

Published on: January 1, 2023
Source: Times of India

The Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna starrer Pushpa 2 has shattered records on its 28th day at the box office, earning over Rs 10 crore on New Year's day.

  1. The film's success has led to increased demand for its sequel.
  2. The movie has been a major hit in both Telugu states and Hindi markets.
"This is a phenomenal achievement for a Telugu film," said trade analyst Taran Adarsh.

With its impressive run at the box office, Pushpa 2 is expected to cross the Rs 100 crore mark in the coming days.

item.title: Delhi shivers for third consecutive cold day; Himachal, J&K brace for fresh snowfall | Weather updates - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi shivers for third consecutive cold day; Himachal, J&K brace for fresh snowfall | Weather updates

Date: Jan 02, 2025 08:14 AM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

Delhi has experienced its third consecutive day of cold weather, with temperatures significantly below normal. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicts even colder conditions ahead for the region.

  • Minimum temperature in Delhi dropped to 7.4 degrees Celsius.
  • Forecast indicates incoming snowfall for Himachal Pradesh and Jammu & Kashmir.
  • Cold conditions affecting Rajasthan and Uttar Pradesh as well.
  • Fresh snowfall expected in the mid and high hill regions of Himachal Pradesh from January 2.
  • Kashmir preparing for light snow due to western disturbances.
“Smog/moderate fog at most places and dense fog at isolated places is likely in the morning,” IMD forecasts.

As the cold weather persists across northern India, anticipation builds for snowfall in the hilly states, which could lead to significant changes in temperatures and daily life.

item.title: After 40 years, convoy carrying gas tragedy waste heads out of Bhopal - The Times of India
item.description:
After 40 years, convoy carrying gas tragedy waste heads out of Bhopal

Date & Source: Not specified - Times of India

The long-awaited convoy transporting waste from the 1984 Bhopal gas tragedy finally sets out after 40 years of delays, marking a significant step towards environmental cleanup and justice for victims.

  • The waste, a byproduct of the Bhopal gas disaster, is being moved to a special facility for treatment.
  • This operation comes after years of protests and demands from survivors and activists.
  • The government claims that the project prioritizes safety and environmental standards.
"This is a huge victory for all those affected by the disaster; we have waited far too long for this moment." - Activist statement

The movement of this waste is a crucial step for many victims and their families looking for accountability and restitution from the disaster's aftermath.

item.title: NZ bowl in cloudy Nelson; Wickramasinghe, Rajapaksa in for Sri Lanka - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
New Zealand Opts to Bowl First in Final T20I Against Sri Lanka

Date & Source: March 12, 2023, from ESPNcricinfo

Introduction: New Zealand has won the toss and elected to bowl first against Sri Lanka in the final T20I match in Nelson. The hosts aim to secure a 3-0 series sweep.

  1. Unchanged XI for New Zealand: The hosts have decided to stick with the same playing XI that won the first two games.
  2. Sri Lanka's Changes: Bhanuka Rajapaksa and Chamidu Wickramasinghe are in, replacing Kamindu Mendis and Matheesha Pathirana.
  3. Pitch and Conditions: The overcast start might assist the seamers, but the wicket looks good for batting.

Conclusion: New Zealand looks to maintain their winning momentum, while Sri Lanka seeks to avoid a series whitewash.

item.title: NZ bowl in cloudy Nelson; Wickramasinghe, Rakapaksa in for Sri Lanka - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
New Zealand Opts to Bowl First Against Sri Lanka in Final T20I

Date: Not specified | Source: Not specified

New Zealand won the toss and decided to bowl first in the final T20I match against Sri Lanka. With the series already secured at 2-0, New Zealand aims for a clean sweep.

  • New Zealand has chosen to chase, reflecting their successful strategy in the previous matches.
  • The team lineup remains unchanged, emphasizing a youthful and effective squad.
  • Sri Lanka made two changes, bringing in Bhanuka Rajapaksa and Chamidu Wickramasinghe, while Kamindu Mendis and Matheesha Pathirana are dropped.
  • The conditions forecast overcast skies that may favor seamers, but the pitch appears conducive to batting.
Charith Asalanka highlighted the need for the middle order to contribute more runs.

item.title: IND vs AUS: Australia make big change in playing XI for Sydney Test against India - The Times of India
item.description:
Australia Revamps Squad for Sydney Test Against India

Publication Date: Not Specified Source: Times of India

Australia's captain Pat Cummins has announced a significant change in the playing XI for the fifth and final Test against India, with Beau Webster making his Test debut.

  • Beau Webster will replace Mitch Marsh in the squad due to Marsh's poor form.
  • Webster is set to become Australia's 469th men’s Test player.
  • Australia leads the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series 2-1 heading into the final match.
  • Mitchell Starc has been cleared to play despite a rib niggle.
“He was never going to miss this one,” said Cummins about Starc's commitment.

This change aims to enhance Australia's batting strength while facing a competitive Indian side at the SCG.

item.title: PM Modi meets Diljit Dosanjh; calls singer 'multifaceted, blend of talent and tradition' - TOI Etimes
item.description:
PM Modi Meets Diljit Dosanjh

Date: January 2, 2025, Source: Times of India

Prime Minister Narendra Modi met singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh and praised him as 'a combination of talent and tradition'. The two discussed music, culture, and India's vibrancy, including yoga, during their 'memorable' meeting.

  1. Modi lauded Dosanjh's achievements and praised his global success.
  2. Dosanjh admired PM Modi's personal journey and his connection with India.
  3. The meeting concluded with both parties expressing gratitude.
"A fantastic start to 2025. A very memorable meeting with PM @narendramodi Ji." - Diljit Dosanjh

Earlier, Diljit's concert in Ludhiana faced controversy due to songs promoting alcohol, despite previous warnings.

item.title: Delhi Bakery Owner Dies By Suicide Amid Divorce Dispute, Family Says 'Wife Mentally Tortured Him' - News18
item.description:
Delhi Bakery Owner Dies By Suicide Amid Divorce Dispute, Family Blames Mental Torture by Wife

Published on January 02, 2025

A bakery owner in Delhi, Puneet Khurana, died by suicide amidst an ongoing marital dispute with his wife. Found hanging in his Model Town residence, the family alleges that his wife mentally tortured him. The couple married in 2016 and co-owned 'For God’s Cake' bakery and 'Woodbox Cafe'.

The wife was the last person he spoke to, with their conversation reportedly revolving around their bakery business. His family claims that the wife recorded the conversation and shared it with her relatives. Police have seized Khurana's phone and are investigating the case.

"You disrespected me and my family. Tell me what you want now." - Puneet Khurana's wife

The deceased's sister told ANI that Puneet's sister-in-law and parents had mentally tortured him. There's a 59-minute video recording where Puneet details the harassment he faced, including his wife hacking his social media account.

This case follows a similar incident involving Bengaluru-based techie Atul Subhash, who died by suicide last month, also citing harassment by his wife and her relatives.

If you or someone you know needs help, contact any of the listed helplines.

item.title: Norovirus cases surge in USA: 5 key things you need to know - The Times of India
item.description:
Norovirus Cases Surge in the USA: 5 Key Things to Know

Publication Date: December 5, 2023

Source: US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)

Cases of norovirus, a highly contagious stomach bug, are surging in the USA, prompting health officials to underline the importance of preventive measures.

  • During the week of December 5, 91 norovirus outbreaks were reported, up from 69 the previous week.
  • This increase marks a significant rise as the previous years had a maximum of 65 cases at this time.
  • Norovirus is the leading cause of foodborne illness, responsible for 58% of such infections annually in the USA.
  • It spreads through contaminated food, water, surfaces, or close contact with infected individuals.
  • Young children, older adults, and those with weakened immune systems are at higher risk of infection.
“Norovirus is highly contagious, so prevention is key.”

Health officials stress the importance of hygiene and preventive measures to reduce infection rates, especially during peak seasons.

Ajit's mother calls for end to 'differences in Pawar family'

Publication Date: N/A Source: N/A

Ajit's mother appeals for unity within the Pawar family, urging an end to internal conflicts.

  • Ajit's mother expresses deep concern over ongoing family differences.
  • Calls for harmony and collaboration among family members.

"Unity is our strength; we must overcome our differences for the sake of the family."

This appeal highlights the need for reconciliation within the Pawar family during challenging times.

item.title: Manhunt underway after gunman kills ten, injures several in Montenegro restaurant: 'All police teams are - The Times of India
item.description:
Manhunt underway after gunman kills ten, injures several in Montenegro restaurant: 'All police teams are out'

Publication Date: October 15, 2023

Source: Times of India

Authorities in Montenegro are currently conducting a manhunt following a tragic shooting at a local restaurant that left ten people dead and several others injured. Police forces are deployed across the area in a concerted effort to catch the perpetrator.

  • A gunman opened fire in a crowded restaurant.
  • The incident resulted in ten fatalities and numerous injuries.
  • Police are mobilized and actively searching for the shooter.
'All police teams are out,' stated a police spokesperson regarding the ongoing search efforts.

This violent act has shocked the local community and triggered a rapid response from law enforcement.
